title: Why is it a problem that assassins kill you "in less than 3 seconds" but it's not when mages do it?
body:
I'm not denying that there are bad design cases like Talon where he deletes squishies instantly by pressing buttons on them with no counterplay but there are plenty of mages who still effectively do the same thing from range and delete you in less than 3 seconds. But mages will also bring utility to the table and they do their damage from the safety of range. 

I don't mind mages who can be interrupted while they do damage like Malzahar but champions like Annie, Anivia, Ryze, Viktor or anyone who has good synergy with protobelt and can use its active + their spell rotation to gib squishes (Kennen cough cough) walk up to you and kill you instantly and it's not a problem? Many assassins have skill shots just like some of these mages but even if they don't, they have to jump into the middle of a team to do damage and damage is all they bring to the table. Meanwhile, mages still bring ridiculous waveclear and utility to a team and scale much better overall.

I just don't understand the logic when killing you quickly is what assassins are designed to do but now it's a problem but yet this same problem applies to several mages while the level of gameplay is basically identical (limited counterplay) yet it's not a problem. Seems pretty silly.

*prepares for downvotes from mages from fog of war*

That's... a pretty good point, Ohmwrecker passive seems increasingly like an item that should be retooled as an assassin item. I find this more probable since they stated that they want more utility/teamplay for assassins in their items.

First, the issue is not "less than 3 seconds". Fewer than 0.5 seconds from engagement is a more realistic complaint. On average, mages kill people in 3 seconds after using their skills. On average, assassins kill much quicker. There is a very, very noticeable difference in the burst period of the average members of each class.

Second, assassins bring the mobility needed to make their ability to instantly delete people reliable to the point of not caring who else is around the target, and to then get away from an overextension without being in real risk. Mages are way more vulnerable than assassins to getting frontlined out of being able to do their job.

That's not even close to being true.  The only assassins with reliable escapes are Zed and Leblanc.  Every other Assassin is stuck dead center right in the middle of your team when they go in on a target.  The reason assassins need that mobility is to get to the target in the first place because all of them are melee excluding leblanc.  Mages, on the other hand, have long range spells or tons of cc (or both) and some even have good mobility to top that off which makes them much harder to kill when they go in on a team.  Not to mention they have the best itemization in the game so they can go full glass cannon while being tanky at the same time.  Assassins do not have that luxury.  Mages also aren't completely destroyed by exhaust and supports facerolling their keyboards because of all of the utility they bring with them so even if they don't kill their target they still bring a ton of CC to help out their team whereas assassins cannot do that.

People talk about lack of counterplay for Assassins, but then you got Anivia, Annie, Kennen, Lissandra, Orianna, and friends doing comparable damage but this time cc locking you so you can't do anything about their burst while being able to do it safely from range.  At least with Assassins you can use your mobility spells or flash to get away.  Mages just keep you in the same spot and kill you before their CC duration has ended.

Most Mages require hitting a _vital_ skill shot. Lux needs to hit Q, Ahri needs to hit E, Syndra needs to hit QE, etc from _range_ so there's more time to react to their skill shot like Flash, QSS, or just walking away. Most of these Assassins have skill shots, but they're put into basically melee range so there's much less time to react and avoid their vital skill shot like LB E, Zed Q(s), Talon W. I agree most of their damage should be tuned down a little because of their utility and range, but Mages are typically healthier because they offer that utility and waveclear when behind while Assassins if they get behind are useless (they really should be, but they should have at least one thing to contribute to a team if behind) and if they get ahead they _vaporize_ whoever they touch since they're all damage.

By delaying burst patterns in Assassins, they can give more options to them, but right now when you get wiped from existence in under a second, it isn't fun, there's no compelling gameplay, and it's not good for the game imo. Dealing high damage quickly is a necessary evil to stop the rampant hypercarries but the Assassin Update should still fill that niche while giving those hypercarries ways to outplay.
